intro: Tectaria tenerifrons, commonly known as the Canary Island shield fern, is a species native to the Canary Islands. It is a terrestrial fern that belongs to the family Polypodiaceae. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery fronds that are typically divided into segments. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. The spores are produced on the underside of the fronds, contributing to its reproductive strategy.
